comments:
right-click file (not class) in package explorer, refactor rename.


---------
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileOutputStream;

public class FillDisk {

	public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
		String fn = "test.dat";
		int S = 100;
		
		int i=args.length;
		switch(args.length) {
			case 2: S = Integer.parseInt(args[--i]);
			case 1: fn = args[--i];
		}
		
		File f = new File(fn);
		FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream(f);
		int size = S;
		byte[] ba = new byte[1024*1024];
		try {
			System.out.println();
			long t = System.currentTimeMillis();
			while(size-- > 0) {
				fos.write(ba);
				System.out.print('.');
			}
			long d = System.currentTimeMillis() - t;
			System.out.println("\n"+f.getCanonicalPath()+"\nTook "+d+" ms to write "+S+"
megs, "+(1000.0*S/d)+" Megs/s");
		} catch(Exception e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		} finally {
			fos.close();
		}
	}
}
